thread.title: Wolves goalkeeper Aaron McCarey returns after loan deal ends
thread.title_full: Wolves goalkeeper Aaron McCarey returns after loan deal ends

title: Wolves goalkeeper Aaron McCarey returns after loan deal ends
text:
PUBLISHED: October 22, 2015 9:05 am LAST UPDATED: October 22, 2015 3:41 pm Wolves goalkeeper Aaron McCarey returns after loan deal ends Goalkeeper Aaron McCarey has returned to Wolves after his loan deal with Portsmouth expired. Tweet 
The 23-year-old moved to the south coast club as cover with Pompey suffering a keeper injury crisis. 
He made six appearances in his spell with Portsmouth, who are managed by former Wolves midfielder Paul Cook, keeping two clean sheets against Yeovil and Newport. 
The Irishman had spoken of his desire to make the Portsmouth move permanent. 
However the deal has not been extended and McCarey returns to Wolves as third choice behind Emiliano Martinez and Carl Ikeme. 
McCarey tweeted to say: "Thanks to all at Portsmouth, really enjoyed my time there. Great club and fully expect to see them promoted come end of season." 
Wolves still have Tommy Rowe, Lee Evans, Liam McAlinden, Jordan Graham, George Saville, Zeli Ismail and young goalkeeper Harry Burgoyne out on loan. Receive daily email updates from the Express & Star
